subject: Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
author: psi_research
full_text:
Hey Sharon and Ann,

Did you meet Frank S while you were at the Stanley event in November?
He was in the lobby in the evenings showing and discussing his new
Box. He is so pleasant to be around, it seems like there were maybe a
dozen or so people that pulled up chairs to be listen to him up close.

And regarding Mark and his books, Jenneatte (my better half) and I
were at his table assisting him with book sales as his family that
normally accompanies him to these events were not there. -Bill

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
>
> Not to be a downer, but I have never seen a photo taken by the  
> Luminator that did not appear to me to be more than a long or  
> otherwise distorted exposure (I'm very unclear of the effects  
> whatever it is the device supposedly does to a camera mechanism). I  
> wish that wasn't the case, but until I see one of these images that  
> convinces me otherwise, I have to be honest about it.
> 
> Ann

> > > > astounding floods of messages have come through.

> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Hi Robin,
> > > > > Your phrase of "ritualized vs. random" is interesting. There
> > are
> > > > many
> > > > > who believe that communication is between the conscious of the
> > > > > researcher and the entity and the equipment is secondary. It's
> > > > easy to
> > > > > get swept up in the technology and forget there is possibly a
> > > > psychic
> > > > > connection going on. With that said, focusing on equipment
> > actually
> > > > > can help the researcher become receptive to establishing a
> > > > > communication link. While paying attention to the equipment,
> > we
> > > > forget
> > > > > about the daily distractions and minor irritations that may
> > > > prevent us
> > > > > from establishing contact.
> > > > >
> > > > > The setting up the gear we use could be considered the first
> > part of
> > > > > the "ritual". I like to clear my mind, set up equipment, mess
> > with
> > > > it
> > > > > some more, then I am mentally prepare to begin what I hope will
> > be a
> > > > > successful session.
> > > > >
> > > > > I guess "random" recording to me would be what happens in the
> > field
> > > > > during a paranormal investigation. I don't bring Box
> > technology
> > > > into a
> > > > > location with the intention of possibly contacting lingering
> > spirits
> > > > > at that location but I do bring audio recorders in hopes of
> > > > recording
> > > > > evp's.
> > > > >
> > > > > I find the Box works perhaps even better when I'm in a
> > familiar
> > > > place
> > > > > like the room in my home that is designated for that purpose. I
> > do
> > > > > desire to have the finest Box technology that is possible but
> > more
> > > > > important is the association that seems to occur between the
> > > > > researcher and the Box that is favored. Despite some of the
> > benefits
> > > > > of the new gear, the one that I seem to have a connection with
> > is
> > > > one
> > > > > that requires a little more finesse to operate. -Bill
> > > > >
